title: Participation in housekeeping
description: The participation of a patient in daily housekeeping is important, because it contributes to the maintenance of crucial autonomy skills. Also, this process makes the patient feel useful and boosts his/her self-esteem. Most patients are willing to participate, if you suggest to them to do housework that they did in the past. If the patient needs guidance, offer it discreetly.

title: Transactions with public services - Shopping
description: Transactions with public services (banks, IRS) are a good way for the patient to manage his/her personal affairs. Also, shopping in various stores is a chance for him/her to exercise his/her ability to handle money. Remember that your discreet help during the mentioned activities may be necessary.

title: Conversation
description: The participation of the patient in conversations of various subjects is one of the most basic ways to activate his/her cognitive functions. The subjects on which you can talk about are endless: talk about family issues, for current affairs, for the activities of the previous days or ask the patient to give you his/her advice on a matter. His/Her active participation in discussions exercises not only the production of oral speech but also a multitude of other functions, like for example memory and judgement.

title: Reminiscing the past
description: A characteristic symptom of the Alzheimer's disease is that the patient that suffers from it forgets the current events, while he/she is able to recall detailed events from the past. Take advantage of that ability to share memories of past decades. Use all the means available to you, to wake up memories: photographs, personal items of the patient, objects of his/her childhood, familiar scents, old favourite songs, mementos from travels. Do not pressure the patient to remember people or events. That would cause feelings of angst, disappointment and frustration. If he/she is not able to, help him/her by telling him/her the information he/she is looking for.

title: Music and singing
description: Try to listen with the patient to the genre of music that he/she likes. Sing together old favourite songs. Ask from the patient to play a simple melody to the piano. The positive effect of music to the patientâ€™s mood will be apparent no matter what form of it you use.

title: Hobbies
description: If there is a hobby which brings the patient pleasure, encourage him/her to continue with it. Activities like embroidery, knitting, painting or even fishing, exercise various of his/her skills and give him/her a chance to experience the gratification of achieving a goal. The skills associated with the hobbies are usually maintained for years after the manifestation of the disease. Remember that the patients that are in the middle stages of the disease usually need the help of the carer to begin and complete successfully the activity.

title: Reading
description: Reading is an excellent form of mental exercise and that is why it is recommended to the patients with a mild or moderate form of Alzheimerâ€™s disease as a particularly beneficial activity. The kind of reading material chosen is dependent on the abilities and the interests of the patient. Some patients enjoy reading literary works, while others prefer reading the paper or magazines.

title: Board games
description: Cards, backgammon, chess, Scrabble and puzzles are some of the board games that people of all ages enjoy. Play with your loved one games that you know that he/she knew and enjoyed in the past or try playing some of them for the first time.

title: Games with pencil and paper
description: Spend a pleasant afternoon with the patient, playing with him/her simple games that only requires paper and a pencil. Games like hangman, tic/tac/toe and connect the dots will remind him/her of his/her childhood and mobilize him/her mentally. Print games can be another form of mental exercise, mainly for patients with a mild case of Alzheimerâ€™s disease. A prime example are crosswords, who exercise effectively the memory and the ability of the patients to express themselves, using the appropriate words.

title: Television
description: Television channels offer a wide variety of shows from which you can choose those that will benefit the patient most. Watch quiz shows and try to find together the correct answers. Watch the news and exchange opinions about current events. Watch a movie and talk about its plot.

title: Writing
description: Many older people find the idea of writing their memories and their personal experiences interesting, that way leaving behind a written text that they could read to their children and grandchildren. That is a creative activity with which the patients in the early stages of the disease can be occupied.

title: Excursions - Travels
description: Choose and organize together with your loved one an outing. For example, you can drink your coffee next to the sea, enjoy your meal at a tavern, visit a museum, watch a play in the theatre or go to the cinema. After the completion of the activity, talk about it.

title: Physical exercise
description: Physical exercise helps maintain the existing physical and mental abilities of the patient for longer. The kind of exercise that is suggested, is dependent on the condition of the patient. On many occasions, physical exercise can be achieved through other activities. For example, a patient walking the dog, going shopping to the market or being a member of the traditional dances group in the Senior Center of his/her area, is an indirect way to exercise.
